title: Catch 'em all with Bandai’s new Pokedex smartphone case
text:
By grape Japan

Now that Ash Ketchum has finally won a league and is no longer the biggest loser in anime history, it feels like Pokemon fans should do something to celebrate his long-awaited triumph. Thanks to Premium Bandai, you can now pay homage to cap-wearing Pokemon trainer with a Pokedex smartphone case.

The Pokedex smartphone case faithfully recreates the Pokemon catalog gadget's design with buttons and reader, and the bright bubbly aesthetic seems as if it popped right out of the anime. It can be closed to protect your phone's screen and has accessible openings for charging, buttons, and camera.

It's specifically designed to fit the iPhone X, although it can be used with the iPhone 6, 7, 8 models with limited use of the microphone and flashlight. The case can be ordered directly from Premium Bandai's online shop in Japan, international store, and NintendoSoup. It's priced at 3,980 yen and is scheduled for March 2020 delivery.
